questions.question: Why is note-taking important for learning?
options: It clarifies ideas, organizes thoughts, and improves recall
It eliminates the need to study later
questions.explanation: Good note-taking actively engages you in the learning process and improves understanding and memory.

questions.question: What are the three sections of the Cornell Method?
questions.explanation: The Cornell Method divides the page into cues, detailed notes, and a summary section to reinforce structure and review.

questions.question: How does mind mapping support note-taking?
options: It stores notes in a linear format
It uses graphs to analyze data
It creates visual connections between ideas
questions.explanation: Mind mapping uses a central idea with branches to visually organize and connect information.

questions.question: Why is summarizing notes in your own words effective?
options: It shortens your notes for easier review
It encourages deeper processing and understanding
questions.explanation: Summarizing in your own words ensures you actually understand the material and improves memory retention.

questions.question: What is one tip for making your notes clearer?
questions.explanation: Bullet points make notes more readable and structured, making them easier to review later.
